content.description: This is the route squeezed between Wall Strike and Big Black Cadillac.  The route goes up the outside of the arch towards the pine tree at the top.  You will find the anchors just right of the small pine.  You scramble up easy grey rock just left of the cave formation to your first bolt on the brown colored rock.  Grab the flake trying not to pull it off or rain down rocks on your partner.  The higher you grab it, the better the rock.  Make a couple fun well protected moves and you will find yourself at the top.
content.protection: Sport Rack, don't remember the number of draws.  7 maybe.
content.location: This is the route squeezed between Wall Strike and Big Black Cadillac that goes right up the arch towards the pine tree at the top.

content.description: The right line of the 2 routes that share the first 3 bolts.  Climb the 3 first bolts, head right and go past 3 more bolts where you encounter the crux.  Some slightly cryptic moves lead to a jug above...then another easy move to the anchors.  Fun crux moves!
content.protection:
6 Stainless bolts + Double Mussy Anchor 

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent.  No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents.  Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety.  Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.
content.location: 4th from the left route.  The right branching line from the 3 bolts shared with The Flying Oehlers.

content.description: Climb left of some slightly chossy blocks and up to the first bolt.  Follow bomber rock to the last bolt and climb slightly left of the last bolt to a slightly awkward anchor clipping stance.
content.protection:

content.location: Far left route on Blue Sky Bluff.  About 15 feet left of FF is Neither.

content.description:
The far right corner just right of Bad Seed.   

  Warning!  This route still has some loose rock on it!  I have climbed it a few times without breaking anything, but there is still some dangerous rock on this due to the loose stuff that makes the corner. If one avoids the corner, it seems to be totally bomber rock...but also harder than 5.9.

content.location: Far right route, just right of Bad Seed.

content.description:
A seriously cool climb on awesome rock. Every type of hold on this route. Really fun. This is the route with the obvious crack/flake at 2/3's up. Amazingly fun route for 5.8 at Mt. C.

 If you look up and left from the anchor you will see another set of double bolts from which you can top rope the line between Low Pull and this route. That line was not bolted as it would be a squeeze job.

content.location: Second Route from the left on this wall.  About 15 right of Low Pull.

content.description: The left split of the two routes that start with a shared 3 first bolts.  Fun crimping on some slightly sharp holds leads to a rest and then a roof encounter on some amazing ergo holds and some crimpy fun to get established on the headwall.  Good fun!

content.location: 3rd from the left.  20 feet right of Freeflying is Neither.  Start on the 3 shared bolts with Wall Strike and branch to the left.

content.description: Just right of Black Death is Blue Skies. A great technical line with some great moves on good rock. Very technical and crimpy. A really fine line!
content.protection:

content.location: Just right of Black Death.  The 6th route from the left.

content.description:
The first route right of the unbolted scooped/overhanging area.  This route might need more cleaning in the crack/ramp area.  Beware the black death guano. 

  Not a very consistent route. Basically it is 5.10+ climbing to a 3-4 move V6/7? to 5.9 climbing.  

  Crux is an undercling above ramp to a nasty upside down sidepull or gaston to two micro-crimps to a jug above and left of the 5th bolt. Vicious!
content.protection:
6 stainless bolts to double mussy anchor.

content.location: Just right of the unbolted overhanging area.  There is a crack/ramp area after the 2nd bolt.

content.description:
Follow a traversing line of crimps to the obvious traversing line of all natural pockets. The first bolt is just left of the first bolt of Going In.

 The super fun crux is at the 4th bolt. BIG undercling move off a bomber pocket on bad feet to a rad half pad 2 finger side pull (pocket like feature).

 I really enjoyed climbing this route!

content.location: Far right side of the cliff.  Starts just right of the rad little somewhat hidden cave.  About 30 feet right of Blue Skies and essentially starts on the start of Going In.  (Don't clip the first bolt of Going In).  It is THE obvious line of pockets.

content.description: The trees hide this nearly roadside crag (a short <10 minute hike). It has 8 lines on great rock. It receives excellent afternoon shade in the summer (~2pm...similar to Hood).It is comfy to climb here after 2pm when the valley is above 100. When it is in the 80's in the valley, you can climb here all day,and you can also climb here in the sun (before noon) when the temps are cool (spring/fall).Thank you to those who contributed to developing this cliff.
